titles.title: Continuing Appropriation (sixth)
Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 1996, and for other purposes.

action.text: CONSIDERATION OF LEGISLATION - Mr. Walsh unanimous consent to call up the resolution, that the resolution be considered as passed, and that a motion to reconsider be laid on the table.
Mr. Durbin objected to the unanimous consent request.
CONSIDERATION OF LEGISLATION - - Mr. Walsh unanimous consent to call up the resolution, that the resolution be considered as passed, and that a motion to reconsider be laid on the table.
Mr. Walsh asked unanimous consent to consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 1/3/1996--Introduced. Makes continuing appropriations for FY 1996, at a level that is to be no more than the current level, for the District of Columbia. (Sec. 106) Makes appropriations in this title available, unless otherwise provided for in this title or an applicable appropriations Act, until the first of the following events: (1) enactment of an appropriation for any project or activity of this title; (2) enactment of the applicable appropriations Act without any provision for such project or activity; or (3) January 25, 1996. (Sec. 111) Provides that if funding is not provided for an ongoing project or the projects's rate of operations is significantly reduced it may be continued at a minimal level. Defines minimal level as the current rate reduced by 25 percent. (Sec. 116) Prohibits the use of funds appropriated under this title to implement any system of registration of unmarried cohabiting couples, whether homosexual, lesbian, or heterosexual.
